greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: GCD of the prime indices of n, all plus 1.
comment: Zeros are ignored when computing GCD, and the empty set has GCD 0.
A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798.
example: 85 has prime indices {3,7}, so a(85) = GCD(4,8) = 4.
xref: Positions of records (first appearances) appear to be A116974.
The GCD of the prime indices of n, all minus 1, is A328167(n).
The LCM of the prime indices of n, all plus 1, is A328219(n).
Partitions whose parts plus 1 are relatively prime are A318980.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Oct 09 2019
